whitebox.geospatialfiles

Class WhiteboxRasterBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • whitebox.geospatialfiles.WhiteboxRasterBase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    WhiteboxRaster, WhiteboxRasterInfo

    public class WhiteboxRasterBase
extends java.lang.Object
    The base class serving the WhiteboxRaster and WhiteboxRasterInfo subclasses.

      • WhiteboxRasterBase

        public WhiteboxRasterBase(java.lang.String HeaderFile)
        Class constructor. Notice that the data file name will also be set based on the specified header file name.
        Parameters:
        HeaderFile - The name of the WhiteboxRaster header file.

    • Method Detail

      • getHeaderFile

        public java.lang.String getHeaderFile()
        Gets the header file (*.dep) name for this Whitebox raster grid. Notice that the header file name is set during object creation.
        Returns:
        A string containing the reference to the header file.

        Returns:
        A string containing the reference to the header file.

      • getDataScale

        public WhiteboxRasterBase.DataScale getDataScale()

      • setDataScale

        public void setDataScale(WhiteboxRasterBase.DataScale dataScale)

      • getDataType

        public WhiteboxRasterBase.DataType getDataType()
        Retrieves the data type for this Whitebox grid. Data type may be DataType.DOUBLE, DataType.FLOAT (decimal numbers), DataType.INTEGER (whole numbers from -32,768 to 32,767), or DataType.BYTE (whole number from 0 to 255).
        Returns:
        Data type.

      • setDataType

        public void setDataType(WhiteboxRasterBase.DataType dataType)
        Sets the data type for this Whitebox grid. Data type may be DataType.DOUBLE, DataType.FLOAT (decimal numbers), DataType.INTEGER (whole numbers from -32,768 to 32,767), or DataType.BYTE (whole number from 0 to 255).
        Parameters:
        DataType - The specified data type.

      • getRowValues

        public double[] getRowValues(int row)
        This method should be used when you need to access an entire row of data at a time. It has less overhead that the getValue method and can be used to efficiently scan through a raster image row by row.
        Parameters:
        row - An int stating the zero-based row to be returned.
        Returns:
        An array of doubles containing the values store in the specified row.

      • getRowValues

        public double[] getRowValues(int row,
                             int stack)
        This method should be used when you need to access an entire row of data at a time. It has less overhead that the getValue method and can be used to efficiently scan through a raster image row by row.
        Parameters:
        row - An int stating the zero-based row to be returned.
        stack - An int stating the zero-based stack in which the row is located.
        Returns:
        An array of doubles containing the values store in the specified row.

      • getColumnValues

        public double[] getColumnValues(int col)
        This method should be used when you need to access an entire column of data at a time. It has less overhead that the getValue method and can be used to efficiently scan through a raster image column by column.
        Parameters:
        col - An int stating the zero-based column to be returned.
        Returns:
        An array of doubles containing the values store in the specified row.

      • getPixelValues

        public double[] getPixelValues()
        This method returns all of the pixel data contained in a raster as a double array.
        Returns:
        An array of doubles containing the values store in the specified.

      • getPixelValues

        public double[] getPixelValues(int stack)
        This method returns all of the pixel data contained in a raster for a specified stack as a double array.
        Parameters:
        stack - An int stating the zero-based stack in which the row is located.
        Returns:
        An array of doubles containing the values store in the specified.

      • setPixelValue

        public void setPixelValue(int row,
                          int column,
                          double value)
        This is a lightweight method of setting individual pixel values. It writes values directly to the file without the use of a buffer. As such it is only useful for setting small numbers of pixels. The setValue method of the WhiteboxRaster class offers a buffered means of setting individual pixel values and is far better suited to setting larger numbers of pixels. This method should only be used for existing files.
        Parameters:
        row - Pixel zero-based row number.
        column - Pixel zero-based column number.
        value - Pixel value to set.

      • findMinAndMaxVals

        public void findMinAndMaxVals()
        Used to find the minimum and maximum values in the raster. NoDataValues are ignored. Minimum and maximum values are stored in the minimumValue and maximumValue fields.

      • getPercentileValue

        public double getPercentileValue(double percentile)

      • deleteStatsFile

        public void deleteStatsFile()

      • readStatsFile

        public void readStatsFile()

      • createStatsFile

        public void createStatsFile()
        Creates a .wst file to store information about the statistical distribution of the raster, including the min, max, mean, mode, stdev, and the histogram. These data are used for clipping the tails of the distribution for enhanced visualization.

      • getColumnFromXCoordinate

        public int getColumnFromXCoordinate(double x)

      • getRowFromYCoordinate

      • getYCoordinateFromRow

        public double getYCoordinateFromRow(int row)

      • close

        public void close()
